goals.question: What is the correlation between X and Y?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of X and Y
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to understand the relationship between two variables and whether they are positively or negatively correlated.

goals.question: What is the mean and standard deviation of X?
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to understand the distribution of X and whether it is normally distributed or skewed.

goals.question: What is the range of Y?
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to understand the spread of Y and whether there are any outliers or extreme values.

goals.question: What is the relationship between X and Y for different categories of Z?
goals.visualization: Grouped scatter plot of X and Y by Z
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to understand whether the relationship between X and Y is consistent across different categories of Z or whether there are any interactions.

goals.question: What is the distribution of X and Y together?
goals.visualization: Density plot of X and Y
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to understand the joint distribution of X and Y and whether there are any patterns or clusters.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.scatterplot(data=data, x='X', y='Y')
    plt.title('What is the correlation between X and Y?', wrap=True)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='X', kde=True)
    mean_x = data['X'].mean()
    std_x = data['X'].std()
    plt.axvline(mean_x, color='r', linestyle='--', label=f'Mean: {mean_x:.2f}')
    plt.axvline(mean_x + std_x, color='g', linestyle='--', label=f'Std Dev: {std_x:.2f}')
    plt.axvline(mean_x - std_x, color='g', linestyle='--')
    plt.legend()
    plt.title('What is the mean and standard deviation of X?', wrap=True)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.boxplot(y=data['Y'])
    plt.title('What is the range of Y?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.scatterplot(data=data, x='X', y='Y', hue='Z')
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.title('What is the relationship between X and Y for different categories of Z?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.kdeplot(data=data, x='X', y='Y', cmap='viridis', shade=True)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of X and Y together?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
